title: BioShock Remastered
notes:
Using launch options: `PROTON_NO_ESYNC=1 %command% -windowed`
PROTON_NO_ESYNC=1 is necessary to fix low resolution textures.
A grey transparent box/seam is visible during gameplay but is easily ignored.

gpu: X.Org Radeon RX 580 Series (POLARIS10, DRM 3.27.0, 4.19.0-041900rc4-generic, LLVM 6.0.0)
notes:
Ryzen 1700x / RTX 580 (8GB)

PROTON_USE_WINED3D11=1 %command% allows it to run, but it runs at about 20fps. I tried adding PROTON_NO_ESYNC=1 (as some people said it made the game work for them) but it did not help FPS issues.
title: BioShock™ Remastered

gpu: X.Org Radeon RX 580 Series (POLARIS10, DRM 3.27.0, 4.19.0-041900rc4-generic, LLVM 8.0.0)
notes: Same poster as just below this. I got it working a great framerate after doing a lot of updates, I'm not sure what fixed it, but maybe updating to the develop branch of MESA. WINED3D had to be set to 0 for it to fix the lag though.
title: BioShock™ Remastered

notes: Worked perfectly two days ago with no options. Tried no ESYNC but no luck. Opening any menu like options now locks up the game. Same status for release and beta.
title: BioShock™ Remastered

notes: Needs "PROTON_NO_ESYNC=1 %command%", otherwise runs with  low resolution textures. Even with Esync disable, the game stutters frequently.
title: BioShock™ Remastered

notes: Using the following launch options string "PROTON_NO_ESYNC=1 %command% -nointro'. Disabling Esync is required to not have blocky textures. Framedrops sometimes.
title: BioShock™ Remastered

notes: Runs perfectly straight 'out of the box' with no tweaking or launch options required. Played for three hours, no crashes or bugs whatsoever.
title: BioShock™ Remastered
